text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSMedicationAdministration

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSMedicationAdministration 0..*EHDSDataSetMedication administration model

Elements defined in Ancestors:header
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of the administration (e.g. completed, not-done, on-hold, in-progress, unknown)
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 MedicationAdimnistrationStatusCodes
medication 1..1EHDSMedicationAdministered medication
occurrence[x] 1..1Specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place)
occurrenceDateTimedateTime
occurrencePeriodPeriod
reason[x] 0..*Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered
reasonCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
reasonEHDSConditionEHDSCondition
reasonEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
note 0..1stringTextual information about the administration
dosage 0..1EHDSDosagingDetails of how medication was taken
dosageDetails ..1
sequence ..0
repeat ..0
asNeeded 0..0Take as needed

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSMedicationAdministration
title: Medication administration model
description: EHDS refined base model for a single medication administration

element.short: Medication administration model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for a single medication administration

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Patient/subject information
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).
element.definition: Business identifier for the object, unique within its system. Supporting disambiguation between different contexts (systems/countries).

element.short: Resource authoring details. Multiple authors can be provided.
element.definition: Resource authoring details. Multiple authors can be provided.

element.short: Author responsible for the provided information. The exact role of the responsible author varies across use cases and is often specified in individual models.
element.definition: Author responsible for the provided information. The exact role of the responsible author varies across use cases and is often specified in individual models.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of authoring/issuing

element.short: Status of the administration (e.g. completed, not-done, on-hold, in-progress, unknown)
element.definition: Status of the resource or document

element.short: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Administered medication
element.definition: Administered medication

element.short: Specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place)
element.definition: Specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place)

element.short: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered
element.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered

element.short: Textual information about the administration
element.definition: Textual information about the administration

element.short: Details of how medication was taken
element.definition: Details of how medication was taken

element.short: Full dosaging information as human-readable text covering all dosaging steps. Generating the text follows local rules and should include all locally implemented dosaging data even when such elements are not present in this model.
element.definition: Full dosaging information as human-readable text covering all dosaging steps. Generating the text follows local rules and should include all locally implemented dosaging data even when such elements are not present in this model.

element.short: Details of single dosaging scheme step
element.definition: Details of single dosaging scheme step

element.short: Order of the dosage instruction, in case one treatment consists of several dosaging steps. When two schemes share the same sequence number, they are meant to be running in parallel.
element.definition: Order of the dosage instruction, in case one treatment consists of several dosaging steps. When two schemes share the same sequence number, they are meant to be running in parallel.

element.short: Patient oriented instructions as free text for this dosaging step
element.definition: Patient oriented instructions as free text for this dosaging step

element.short: Amount of medication administered per one dose (= one timing)
element.definition: Amount of medication administered per one dose (= one timing)

element.short: Amount of medication per one dose. (1 tablet, 2-3 tablets, 20ml)
element.definition: Amount of medication per one dose. (1 tablet, 2-3 tablets, 20ml)

binding.description: UCUM (units of measurement), EDQM Standard Terms (units of presentation)

element.short: Amount of medication per time period (e.g. 100mg per 1 hour). When rate is provided per 1 time unit, Quantity data type can be used with a suitable unit (e.g. mg/h, ug/min).
element.definition: Amount of medication per time period (e.g. 100mg per 1 hour). When rate is provided per 1 time unit, Quantity data type can be used with a suitable unit (e.g. mg/h, ug/min).

binding.description: UCUM (units of measurement), EDQM Standard Terms (units of presentation)

element.short: Repetition of the administration.
element.definition: Repetition of the administration.

element.short: Time bounds for the treatment (current dosaging scheme). Only one of the following can exist.
element.definition: Time bounds for the treatment (current dosaging scheme). Only one of the following can exist.

element.short: Number of time units, e.g 10 days
element.definition: Number of time units, e.g 10 days

element.short: Start and end date, 05.08.2023 - 10.08.2023
element.definition: Start and end date, 05.08.2023 - 10.08.2023

element.short: Duration of administration (e.g '5 minutes', '1 hour')
element.definition: Duration of administration (e.g '5 minutes', '1 hour')

element.short: Frequency of intake/administration (e.g 'three times a day')
element.definition: Frequency of intake/administration (e.g 'three times a day')

element.short: Number of times per period (e.g '3 times')
element.definition: Number of times per period (e.g '3 times')

element.short: Duration to which the frequency applies (e.g '... / 1 day')
element.definition: Duration to which the frequency applies (e.g '... / 1 day')

element.short: The day of the week of administration, e.g Mon, Tue, etc
element.definition: The day of the week of administration, e.g Mon, Tue, etc

element.short: Exact time of day of administration (e.g '10:00')
element.definition: Exact time of day of administration (e.g '10:00')

element.short: Time period or event when the administration should happen ('before meal', 'immediately', 'morning')
element.definition: Time period or event when the administration should happen ('before meal', 'immediately', 'morning')

element.short: Take as needed
element.definition: Take as needed

element.short: Body site of administration
element.definition: Body site of administration

element.short: Route of administration
element.definition: Route of administration

element.short: Medication administration model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for a single medication administration

Administered medication
element.definition: Administered medication

element.definition: Specific date/time or interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place)

element.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was administered
